verses.text: Better \add it is\add* to have no children, and to have virtue: for the memorial thereof is immortal: because it is known with God, and with men.

When it is present, \add men\add* take example at it; and when it is gone, they desire \add it:\add* it weareth a crown, and triumpheth for ever, having gotten the victory, striving for undefiled rewards.
But the multiplying brood of the ungodly shall not thrive, nor take deep rooting from bastard slips, nor lay \add any\add* fast foundation.
For though they flourish in branches for a time; yet standing not fast, they shall be shaken with the wind, and through the force of winds they shall be rooted out.
The unperfect branches shall be broken off, their fruit unprofitable, not ripe to eat, yea, meet for nothing.
For children begotten of unlawful beds are witnesses of wickedness against \add their\add* parents in their trial.
But though the righteous be prevented with death, \add yet\add* shall he be in rest.
For honourable age \add is\add* not that which standeth in length of time, nor \add that\add* is measured by number of years.
But wisdom is the gray hair unto men, and an unspotted life \add is\add* old age.
He pleased God, and was beloved \add of him:\add* so that living amongst sinners he was translated.
\add Yea\add*, speedily was he taken away, lest that wickedness should alter his understanding, or deceit beguile his soul.
For the bewitching of naughtiness doth obscure \add things that are\add* honest; and the wandering of concupiscence doth undermine the simple mind.
He, being made perfect in a short \add time\add*, fulfilled a long time:
for his soul pleased the Lord: therefore hasted he \add to take him away\add* from among the wicked.

\add This\add* the people saw, and understood \add it\add* not, neither laid they up this in \add their\add* minds, that \add his\add* grace and mercy \add is\add* with his saints, and \add that he hath\add* respect unto his chosen.
Thus the righteous that is dead shall condemn the ungodly which are living; and youth that is soon perfected the many years and old age of the unrighteous.
For they shall see the end of the wise, and shall not understand what \add God\add* in his counsel hath decreed of him, and to what \add end\add* the Lord hath set him in safety.
They shall see \add him\add*, and despise him; but God shall laugh them to scorn: and they shall hereafter be a vile carcase, and a reproach among the dead for evermore.

For he shall rend them, \add and cast them down\add* headlong, \add that they shall be\add* speechless; and he shall shake them from the foundation; and they shall be utterly laid waste, and be in sorrow; and their memorial shall perish.
And when \add they\add* cast up the accounts of their sins, they shall come with fear: and their own iniquities shall convince them to their face.
